modules.description: This module parses and generates raw ID3v2 binary tags, supporting operations like header parsing, frame attachment, and tag rendering. It works with raw strings and typed tag structures in various states (`Invalid`, `Parsed`, `Valid`), allowing direct manipulation of ID3v2 frames and metadata such as title, artist, and year. Concrete use cases include building or modifying ID3v2 tags in memory before writing them to an MP3 file or analyzing ID3v2 tag data without file association.

This module allows creating and manipulating tags independently of audio files, working directly with raw tag data and structured metadata representations. It supports operations like setting tag fields (e.g., title, artist) and managing tag versions in memory. Use cases include constructing or editing tags before embedding them into audio files or extracting and transforming tag data for processing or display.

This module provides functions to open, close, save, and inspect audio files, supporting formats like MP3, FLAC, and Ogg. It reads and writes metadata tags and audio properties such as length, bitrate, and sample rate using UTF8-encoded strings. Concrete use cases include editing ID3 tags in MP3 files and extracting duration or bitrate from FLAC or Ogg Vorbis files.

This module provides functions to read, write, and manipulate metadata tags (e.g., title, artist, album) for audio files like MP3, FLAC, and Ogg, along with retrieving audio properties such as duration, bitrate, and sample rate. It operates on both file-based audio data and in-memory tag structures, enabling tasks like batch metadata editing, audio file analysis, or dynamic tag generation without modifying the original file content.
